author: radekkapka
content: This time I have a question about https://ethereum.github.io/eth2.0-APIs/#/Config/getDepositContract. Is the `chain_id` return value supposed to be in the same format as `previous_version` and `current_version` in  https://ethereum.github.io/eth2.0-APIs/#/Config/getForkSchedule ?

author: radekkapka
content: So the example `"1"` value is fine? Or should it be `"0x00000001"`?

author: radekkapka
content:
I am not sure what is the difference between a chain ID and a fork version, especially when the description of `getDepositContract` says 
> Retrieve deposit contract address and **genesis fork version**.

author: mpetrunic
content: Tbh we could make chain id to be represented as hex. Only difference is that hex chain id should be converted to number with be while fork version should use le ðŸ˜…

author: jgm
content: Chain ID is just a number, so the current representation of quoted number seems fine.  There could be an argument to go either way, but now that we have something better to stick with it unless there is a real benefit to change.
